permanent_sub_1_Darknights_Memoir.name: Darknights Memoir
permanent_sub_1_Darknights_Memoir.detail:
This is the story of a mercenary, venturing through life and death on the battlefield.
This is the story of a follower, trusted by others yet failing to protect.
This is the story of a dissident, fighting endlessly, scorning life and death all the while.
This is the story of W, and her companions.

permanent_sub_2_A_Walk_In_The_Dust.name: A Walk in the Dust
permanent_sub_2_A_Walk_In_The_Dust.detail:
The extent of Kal'tsit's influence is immeasurable.
Ursus, Victoria, and Sargon all bear marks of her presence.
Whatever her role may be, she firmly and persistently pursues her own vision.
Those who journey alongside her, too, are busily authoring the stories of their own lives.
Time stops for no one, and Kal'tsit continues marching onward.

permanent_sub_3_Under_Tides.name: Under Tides
permanent_sub_3_Under_Tides.detail:
Skadi hears the trill of a long unheard melody at Rhodes Island.
Following the sound, she meets Gladiia.
Yet, this former comrade swiftly disappears after little more than a glimpse.
She kidnapped Specter, leaving nothing but a name for Skadi.
'Sal Viento', a lethargic and mysterious coastal town.
There, Skadi will unravel the mystery of her and her companions' bloodline.

permanent_sub_4_Stultifera_Navis.name: Stultifera Navis
permanent_sub_4_Stultifera_Navis.detail:
A nation sunken in silence has left its legacy upon the waves.
The Hunters follow their kin's trail to where the clues converge.
Stultifera Navis, the golden ship, a monument to civilization.
Kal'tsit warns that humanity must unite.
Iberia no longer knows the sea, and Ægir has taken in foreign blood.
The sea alone is the source of all life, and the sea alone is unchanging.

permanent_sidestory_1_Grani_And_The_Trea.name: Grani and the Knights' Treasure
permanent_sidestory_1_Grani_And_The_Trea.detail:
Dewville, a remote village in Kazimierz has been occupied by bounty hunters.
These bounty hunters indiscriminately rampage and ruin, apparently in an attempt to find the knight's treasure said to be buried here.
After receiving a request for help, Mounted Police Grani volunteers to resolve the problem.
Can she really drive out the bounty hunters?
Will she find the mysterious knight's treasure?
Will peace return to Dewville?
Let's find it out.

permanent_sidestory_2_Heart_Of_Surging_F.name: Heart of Surging Flame
permanent_sidestory_2_Heart_Of_Surging_F.detail:
The Obsidian Festival is in full swing in the town of Siesta!
The Operators of Rhodes Island have come for a vacation as well.
Not before long, they learned that the eruption of a nearby volcano is imminent!
But it seems the town's government is trying to cover it up?!
In the midst of the summer heat, music and battle, 
Rhodes Island will set out with the mayor's daughter, Ceylon.
Will they manage to save the day?

permanent_sidestory_3_Code_Of_Brawl.name: Code of Brawl
permanent_sidestory_3_Code_Of_Brawl.detail:
Bison of MountainDash Logistics was ambushed and is hanging on for dear life?
His saviors are not his father's men, but Penguin Logistics?
It's Sauin, yet the darker undercurrents of Lungmen are out in force?
Who is the actual underground mastermind of Lungmen?
MountainDash Logistics? Penguin Logistics? The Siracusan Mafia? Or someone else?
In the dark of the night, an unmissable feast is about to begin!

permanent_sidestory_4_Twilight_Of_Wolumo.name: Twilight of Wolumonde
permanent_sidestory_4_Twilight_Of_Wolumo.detail:
Folinic and Suzuran arrive at this place, searching for the missing Atro.
Wolumonde, 'The Eighth Moon' of the Leithanien's Winterwisp Mountains.
Under the threat of Catastrophes, the town remains still while suspicion lurks in the people's eyes.
A great fire extinguishes many lives, but from the ashes more questions rise.
With the arrival of Reunion, the conflict between the Infected and the townsfolk reaches a climax.
Will this incident be resolved? Will there be answers to the mystery?
Please investigate the truth hidden in the twilight, alongside the operators of Rhodes Island.

permanent_sidestory_5_The_Great_Chief_Re.name: The Great Chief Returns
permanent_sidestory_5_The_Great_Chief_Re.detail:
The doctor, Gavial, and co. travel to Gavial's hometown on a low-altitude aircraft.
Acahualla, a place of lush forests within Sargon.
Close to their destination, the aircraft is struck down!
The doctor and Gavial have no choice but to travel on foot to the settlements to seek help.
What plots and threats do the vast rainforests hide?
Will the Rhodes Island operators be able to repair their aircraft and return?
Gavial, this is your home turf. It's all on you now!

permanent_sidestory_6_Maria_Nearl.name: Maria Nearl
permanent_sidestory_6_Maria_Nearl.detail:
Consumption and entertainment suffuse the modern land of the knights.
For the sake of her family's prestige,
a young Maria Nearl embarks on the path to the Kazimierz Major.
However, the young lady has yet to realize the meaning the word 'knight' now carries,
nor is she aware of the inner workings of modern Kazimierz......
A long and arduous journey lies ahead of Maria.

permanent_sidestory_7_Mansfield_Break.name: Mansfield Break
permanent_sidestory_7_Mansfield_Break.detail:
Years ago, Anthony Simon was incarcerated in Mansfield State Prison. 
All the while, he has been plotting to escape and uncover the truth. 
Little did he know, a plot targeting him was unfolding at the same time. 
Silence who coincidentally discovered Anthony's existence, Saria who had already taken action, 
Muelsyse whose intentions remain uncertain, as well as HydeBro and the Director of Energy behind them. 
Perhaps a late-night talk in the bar will shed some light on the truth behind this conspiracy, 
and lift a corner off the veil of secrecy covering Rhine Lab.

permanent_sidestory_8_Who_is_Real.name: Who is Real
permanent_sidestory_8_Who_is_Real.detail:
Lava and Kroos, who arrived in Yan at the behest of Nian, 
meet a resident of Yan who encountered some trouble in the wilderness, Mr. Nothing. 
Together, the three of them follow the clues and search for Mount Hui-ch'i, to look for Nian's sister. 
An unassuming thatched house reveals a hidden world the moment they enter. 
Regaining their wits, they find themselves in a quaint little Yan town. 
Beneath the coexisting sun and moon, the town besieged by spirits of ink. A mysterious monk whose words bring truth:
True or false, false or true, you and I are but inhabitants of a painting.

permanent_sidestory_9_Dossoles_Holiday.name: Dossoles Holiday
permanent_sidestory_9_Dossoles_Holiday.detail:
Ch'en was invited to spend the summer at Dossoles, Bolívar.
Little did she know that she would run into Lin Yühsia there.
Meanwhile, the most unique city in Bolívar is about to hold its most significant annual event: the 
Dossoles Warrior Championship.
Where there is light, however, there is always shadow,
and this shadow threatens to consume the entire city.
What is the danger that Ch'en and Lin Yühsia are sensing?

permanent_sidestory_10_Near_Light.name: Near Light
permanent_sidestory_10_Near_Light.detail:
The return of the Radiant Knight 
pushes the Special Knight Tournament to a climax. 
At the same time, in the dark corners where the neon lights do not shine, 
the suppressed roars are about to break their shackles. 
On the stage, the paths of the knights cross. 
Below the stage, the city lingers on the brink. 
Soon, the two paths will converge...

permanent_sidestory_11_Break_The_Ice.name: Break the Ice
permanent_sidestory_11_Break_The_Ice.detail:
The mountains guard ancient beliefs 
and the snow hides great dangers 
in this realm of snow.
The gods have watched over these 
rarely-visited cliffs for a thousand years.
Smoke rises gently from chimneys in this peaceful land,
its tranquility broken by a great train rushing through.

permanent_sidestory_12_Invitation_To_Win.name: Invitation to Wine
permanent_sidestory_12_Invitation_To_Win.detail:
The dreamer becomes drunk at the ancient pavilion.
The spring gusts blow through the mountains, and the shadow reveals its true face through the clouds.
Old matters yet to be resolved, a new game of chess has begun in Shangshu.
A visitor from distant Lungmen,
an antique goblet hidden in a box,
a piece that has long been in the game,
a lonely little boat, rowed into Shancheng.

act9d0_01.name: Buried
act9d0_01.description: Hide your thoughts. Hide them from yourself. Raise your sword and staff. A soldier must always move forward.

act9d0_02.name: By Chance
act9d0_02.description:
Several accidental betrayals. Several inevitable rescues.

act9d0_03.description:
Would you feel honored to fight alongside living legends and enshrined heroes? Or would you fear for the inevitable tragedy that ensues in every epic?

act9d0_04.name: Advance
act9d0_04.description: The story of every battle will be copied hundreds upon thousands of times, tucked away in places where nobody will see them. Not all soldiers will be remembered.

act9d0_05.name: Banner
act9d0_05.description:
A flag trampled into the mud is worthless, but according to some, these pieces of cloth representing these ideals worth fighting for were never flown at all.

act9d0_06.description: This is but one cycle. Each person will walk from one end to the other and repeat the process, again and again.

act9d0_07.name: Cracked
act9d0_07.description:
Being betrayed over and over is much like wringing a sponge. It may return to its original shape sooner or later, but it will be wrung again.

act9d0_08.name: Separated
act9d0_08.description:
The only way to overturn fate is to gamble. Only reckless actions with indeterministic results can avoid the inevitable causality of striving for the same goal through different means.
<@lv.item><Originium Jetstream></>Continuously generates currents of airflow. Operators deployed downstream/upstream will deal increased/decreased damage; Enemies moving downstream/upstream will have increased/decreased Movement Speed.

act9d0_st01.description: To her child she spoke. To herself she spoke.

act9d0_ex01.description: Every washed-up greenhorn at the bar thinks they can take on ten thousand enemies. When charging, they naturally assume that those ten thousand are only coming at them.

act9d0_ex01#f#.description:

act9d0_ex02.description:
After several incidents of friendly-fire related accidental injuries caused by heavily-armed forces, the Scar Market congenially rolled out their 'Injury Insurance' policy while simultaneously strengthening the explosive power of their equipment to ensure that the injured wouldn't be able to make it back.

act9d0_ex03.description:
The use of Originium Arts is generally considered cheating in the Scar Market's regular 100-meter rush competition for armed mercenaries.

act9d0_ex04.description:

act9d0_ex05.name: War Preparations
act9d0_ex05.description: The 'Mercenary Zone' is not exactly a great place to be. In most cases, people who enter the 'Zone' must first have their chests penetrated by bolts or fireballs before they use alcohol or other substances to 'enter the Zone.'

act9d0_ex05#f#.name: War Preparations
act9d0_ex05#f#.description:

Will it snow if there's enough of a temperature difference between the left and right exhaust outlets?

act9d0_mo01.name: The Town of Taba
act9d0_mo01.description:
There's nothing necessarily prestigious about the battlefield, nor is there any fundamental reason for them to exist. Violence is not a reasonable thing, and sometimes, things happen simply because they happened.<@lv.fs>Condition:</>
DP will not naturally regenerate.

act18d0_01.name: The Siege of Redhorn
act18d0_01.description: The arrival of a squad from Columbia throws an unremarkable Sargon village into turmoil.

act18d0_tr01.name: Air Support Training
act18d0_tr01.description:
The new combat methods employed by these well-funded mercenaries demand extra attention during battle.
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_02.name: A Bolt From the Blue Oasis
act18d0_02.description:
Kal'tsit and the survivors travel on foot to a large oasis, where many animals come to slake their thirst. Of course, enemy scouting drones are here too, things that are much less reliant on water.
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_03.name: Cactus Dunes
act18d0_03.description:
Elliot silently takes count - a total of three hundred fifteen cacti on the dunes.
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_04.name: Blockade of the Singing Sands
act18d0_04.description: The shifting of each grain of sand tells a story. As Kal'tsit predicted, the pursuing soldiers arrive on schedule, throwing themselves into the snare.

act18d0_st01.name: Pine Lilies
act18d0_st01.description: No patch of soil pays any heed to the blossoming of a few clusters of flowers— The land does not care, for the land encompasses all things.

act18d0_05.name: Reefsteep's Land
act18d0_05.description:
'The land encircled by reefs,' 'a place where reefs are embraced.' Looking up, Elliot sees no reefs. Are the people here hallucinating?
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_06.name: Padishah's Dream
act18d0_06.description:
A city full of hope, an oasis that rises in response. Clear, flowing water and adamant mountains surround Padishah. Amidst raucous cries and choking smoke, the dream shall come to its end.
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_07.name: Homeland
act18d0_07.description:
The destitute and homeless are entrusted to the estate of the missing magnate. The mercenary assassin glares beneath the moonlight. At dawn, Old Isin looks up to the stars. The chilly morning wind blows, and he still misses his terrible home.
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_st02.name: Visitors From Afar
act18d0_st02.description: He had never felt so strongly about the journey he took in his younger years, until today. He suddenly felt dazed. Though he hated the desert, he never thought about where he could go.

act18d0_ex01.name: Pack Tactics
act18d0_ex01.description:
Nobody knows the origins of this 'hound' species, but the people of Bolívar were the first to use them in battle. Well-trained hounds provided a significant advantage on the field.
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

<@lv.fs>Condition:</>

act18d0_ex02.name: Converging Lines
act18d0_ex02.description:
Well-trained mercenaries are often able to execute two-pronged attacks, and even capture targets in complex terrain— Wait, wait, when did a third team show up? Who gave the order to act?!
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_ex03.name: Long-Range Strike
act18d0_ex03.description: A well-trained assault force will thin out defenders using long-ranged strikes before sweeping through with ground forces— Wait, stop! Who let the hounds out?! Tell the crossbowmen to stop!

act18d0_ex04.name: Breaking In
act18d0_ex04.description:
Generally speaking, well-trained mercenaries will act according to your timetables during an assault— W-Wait, where are your hounds? Why'd your snipers go in first? What about your armored units? How come there's only one person in your vanguard?!
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_ex05.name: Crossfire Support
act18d0_ex05.description:
A battlefield's terrain is complex. When encountering a combat situation with asymmetrical firepower, a well-trained... Hey... Can't you see the enemy right next to you? Do you seriously have to chase the farthest target?
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_ex06.name: Team Captain
act18d0_ex06.description:
'Ranks' must also be observed in mercenary operations. The captain and field commanders for each team should be the best-trained of... Okay, good, they really are the best-trained units.
<@lv.item><Mobile Tactical Hangar></> Deploys drones as needed to assist enemy combatants.

act18d0_ex08.name: As the Empire's Shadow
act18d0_ex08.description: A thousand years have passed since the people of Ursus overthrew the Hippogryph, and the Empire's glory now sweeps across the highest edifices and mountains. It is Ursus's deepest desire to cast the vast shadow of the Emperor's Will across the land.

act18d3_03.name: Outsider
act18d3_03.description: If a conspiracy is conspicuous, it may truly be very difficult to defeat, or the mastermind just isn't very bright.

act17side_01.name: Center Plaza
act17side_01.description: 'A Sea Terror in the Plaza.' Sounds a bit like an Iberian proverb.

act17side_02.name: Plaza South
act17side_02.description: Did they turn to worship the sea because they despaired for the land?

act17side_tr01.name: Penal Battalion Forward Base
act17side_tr01.description: Here, and there too! They're everywhere!

act17side_04.name: Lighthouse Entrance
act17side_04.description:

act17side_s05.name: One's Death
act17side_s05.description: Fame, responsibility, ideals. Everything ends here.

a001_01.name: High Noon
a001_01.description:
Sand is blowing wildly outside Kazimierz. Down from the abandoned gallows there is a greedy, cunning rioter, while behind him stands a knight who has just crossed the desert alone with nothing but the lance in her hand.
<@lv.rem>Some Operators cannot be deployed</>

a001_02.name: Sophistication
a001_02.description: People gather in the bar for all sorts of different reasons. They each have their own axe to grind, but after weighing the pros and cons, decide to work together over a few rounds of beer. However, before they can even take two steps out the door, the temporary truce falls apart violently. Such is the life of bounty hunters.

a001_03.name: An Unexpected Journey
a001_03.description:
Nobody is going to give up the treasure without a fight, and the troublemakers just keep coming one after another. Obviously, most of them have no idea what a 'fair fight' means.
<@lv.rem>Some Operators cannot be deployed</>

a001_04.description:

<@lv.item><Eroded Path></> Operators deployed on these tiles have their DEF reduced by half.

a001_ex01.description: These little critters that have crawled up from underground are extremely dangerous. Their homes have been destroyed as a result of the bounty hunters' rampant excavation, so all they know how to do now is to return the favor.

a001_ex02.name: No Country for Old Men
a001_ex02.description: The terrain is simple but the fighting is gritty. Useless traps and coins are scattered everywhere.

For some, of course, the journey itself is part of the vacation.

a003_01.description:

However, perfection tends to be short-lived, as a massive crisis approaches without warning.
<@lv.rem>Unable to deploy some Operators on the field</>

a003_st02.name: Break Free
a003_st02.description: When paralyzed by a lack of information and preparation, it is recklessness, rather than caution, that has the ability to break the impasse.

a003_02.description: The show must stop, but there are those who disagree.

a003_03.name: Race Walking
a003_03.description: With just a single phone call, you can get all the help you need - even when you are on the run. How reassuring.

a003_04.description: It is rare to find someone in an ordinary city who can match the power of General Hellagur. An unexpected development.

a003_st03.description:
When the one you trust most has betrayed you, are you willing to believe that she has her own reasons? 
Or are there no justifications for betrayal?

a003_05.name: Don't Stop Me Now
a003_05.description: True courage comes from facing and accepting the truth.

a003_06.name: Killer Queen
a003_06.description:
The true villains always appear at the worse possible moment.
Naturally, that's the best possible time for moment for them. 
<@lv.rem>Unable to deploy some Operators on the field</>

a003_st04.name: In the Name of Love
a003_st04.description: Whether true love means watching silently or speaking frankly, there is no clear answer.

a003_07.description: A brightest firework in the grandest ceremony is a thrilling idea, if only the villains don't think so.

act15side_st01.name: The Arrival
act15side_st01.description: Mere moments after our guest arrives in Shangshu, the wine is already uncorked. This is a fated encounter.

act15side_01.name: Apparition
act15side_01.description: Strokes of ink birth spirits. From wares are geists born. A millennium in the human realm elapses in an instant, so surely the sisters must have their own interests.

act15side_02.name: Unseekable Place
act15side_02.description: Is that who you seek at the peak of a cloud-shrouded mount, or perhaps, right there in your dreams?

act15side_03.name: Light and Shadow
act15side_03.description: Did the light come first, or did the shadow? A truly insignificant conundrum.

act15side_04.name: Candleholder
act15side_04.description: A huge shadow yet lurks beneath civilization. Should it reemerges, naturally someone will come bearing a candle for this realm.

act15side_st02.name: All Things Have a Soul
act15side_st02.description: A day without dream sees lives and spirits still.

act15side_05.name: Goods and People
act15side_05.description: Who knows if it's better or worse that rules are rules? It's in past regrets, consuming swathes of one's life, that these rules are still upheld.

act15side_06.name: Legend
act15side_06.description: A vanished peak, black clouds weighing down. Unpinnable rumors are a city's charm. So long as anyone remembers them, it'll never end.

act15side_07.name: Chaos
act15side_07.description: Stones collide, but outside of the board's players, nobody knows which way the game is really going.

act15side_08.name: Obsession
act15side_08.description: The players in this game are many. All told, are these people trapped on the board, or within their own obsessions?

title: How Stars Are Calculated
Operator's Personal Letter
Furniture Pack
desc: Once <color=#0098dc>Record Restoration</color> has become available, the player may attempt the corresponding Event Stages (excluding Story and Training stages). The number of Stars obtained in ratings will be counted towards your total number of Stars. They can be exchanged for <color=#0098dc>Record Restoration</color>'s corresponding rewards.

Raises a specific Operator to Max Potential. Meanwhile, <color=#cc3030>all</color> of the Operator's Tokens will be turned in (used).
If the Operator is already at Max Potential, the Operator's Personal Letter will be opened (used) automatically and the Operator's Tokens <color=#cc3030>will not</color> be turned in (used).

Includes all of the corresponding event's limited Furniture items (excluding purchasable pieces). If all the furniture pieces have been obtained, they may not be obtained again via <color=#0098dc>Record Restoration</color>.

landmarkDesList: This road has already become scantly traveled. Nobody cares about the stories that once unfolded here, nobody remains to record them. Silence falls upon all equally, bringing the same quietude. Only the street sign marks these memories, roughly engraved with the name of this small town— 'Gran Faro.'

Nobody knows why this lighthouse survived the disaster, but perhaps it is because no matter how terrifying the wind and waves may be, nothing can stop people from gazing towards the sea. Iberia's eyes will never close, only be temporarily clouded over.

When disaster struck, both the great flagship Stultifera Navis—the Ship of Fools—and the Iberian fleet to which it belonged were out at sea. Giant waves swallowed everything, but the ghosts of the past still lingered.

The huge dome elevator in the middle of the Stultifera connects the various levels of this great battleship. When riding it, one may witness Iberia's breathtaking scenery depicted across the walls. Standing here is like standing in the center of the world.
On the main deck, the nethersea brand is spreading. It mercilessly engulfs everything, irreversibly. This is how it survives, able to heal wounds left even by the passage of time.
This part of the ocean may have had a name once, but that no longer matters. The premise for a name to be born is that something needs to be distinguished. But now, the ocean is the ocean.

storyDesList: He threw a question into the ancient, bottomless well, and received an answer in return.
He grew up along the coast. He longed for the freedom to see the ocean.
Along the uninhabited street, travelers from afar now sing.
On the long road beside the ocean, the representatives of two civilizations speak herein.
It shuts its eyes, its sweet dreams unperturbed for over a decade.
His eyes widened with anger, his hand not letting go of the helm for decades.
Come as you please, leave in pieces. Freely does wine pour, bodies litter the floor.
There is no road ahead, as far as the eyes can see.
The Seaborn never see their own as enemies. This is a behavior unique to humans.
The unbearable past relentlessly chases him. The unfaceable future solemnly awaits him.
How should one sort out one's thoughts, when reuniting with a mortal enemy after a long absence? Share a dance.
Pack your bags, and return to the starting point. The road ahead is still long.

treasureDesList: 'What the hell was that? Why is this happening to Gran Faro? First the Ægir, then the cultists, and now these damned monsters! I need to leave this place! Otherwise... Otherwise...!'
'I've seen it with my own eyes! The Inquisition's flames will burn a person's soul dry!'
'I leave these things to you!'

Sheds still line the shores, offering a glimpse of how bustling this small town used to be. People from all over used to arrive, trying to restore a glimmer of hope following the calamity. But now, it's been abandoned, its sheets of metal rusting away. The precious materials once used to build this place are now scattered about everywhere, no longer of anyone's concern.

This place may have been inhabited by Ægir Islanders, as the signboards bear faintly-visible patterns distinct from the Iberian style. Now, it is completely uninhabited. And when the previous inhabitants left, they lacked the time to even take their supplies with them.
This is the lighthouse the elders spoke of, the 'Eye of Iberia' in Jordi's dreams. These corridors, stairs, and panels may once have been tread upon and touched by his parents.

Jordi tries to feel an aura of familiarity from them. Countless times, he has sketched his parents' likenesses from his imagination, the way they would shuttle between lighthouses. Those few notes left behind correspond to reality, line by line.

Perhaps their bones are still interred somewhere in this lighthouse. The thought makes Jordi shudder. Now he stands at the same place, his hand covering the same control panel. Where, then, will fate take him?
Jordi decides not to think about these things. He must accomplish his duties, irrespective of his identity, his worth, or his beliefs.
Jordi stands here for the sake of his unrealistic dreams, and though he may be anxious and uncertain, the one thing he is not, is lost.
The warehouse holds supplies designated for the next voyage. The only problem? Nobody knows when that will be, or if it will ever happen.

In a half-opened safe sits an outdated nautical chart, once used by the old Iberian fleet to conquer the seas. The crystallization of their explorations through the mist. Unfortunately, it is now nothing more than scrap paper. A few other miscellaneous items also sit at the bottom of the safe, with nobody left to use them.

Inside the bathroom, everything looks good as new, and drops of water dribble from the spigot. The only unusual thing is that all the mirrors have been shattered, now only able to reflect broken images. There are still unused supplies in the storage box under the sink.

A storage room full of spare sails. Unfold one, and you will find a canvas decorated with golden threads, and carefully embroidered with the pattern of the Iberian flag. Maybe there are some useful supplies to be found here.

The anchor system was completely destroyed during the Profound Silence, and this cabin has been empty for many years. However, someone seems to have turned this place into their own secret stash, leaving behind quite a few glittering things.

The drafting room was once used to aggregate the results of exploration and draft nautical charts. After the calamity, the entire ocean's currents, prevailing winds, and uncharted islands all underwent tremendous changes, rendering the laws formulated over generations completely meaningless. Some usable supplies can still be found here.

Nobody knows what these discarded barrels were once used for. Perhaps over six decades ago, they were filled with spirits that the crew would drink in celebration. Now only a few tattered relics sit at the bottom of the barrel. Who was the desperate seaman who exchanged these things for the last sip of wine?

The Penal Battalion shows no weakness. The Penal Battalion shall not yield. The Penal Battalion is Iberia's bastion, and even the terrible waves do nothing more than wash away any impurities. From this supply station, the soldiers stare at the Iberian soil now swallowed by the ocean.
'These days, I will occasionally dream. Of dazzling golden domes, of my humid hometown.'
'I have never felt water in this form before—soft, cold, beautiful, and deadly.'
'These flames blaze more passionately than any I have felt before, perhaps because my partner in this conversation is that extraordinary.'
'Breogan brought with him not only dreams of gold, but also a warning from the sea. Most people chose to ignore the latter.'
'Nobody can resist their own desires, especially when you understand when they are desiring.'
'Where there is light, there is also a shadow. The brighter the light, the deeper the darkness.'
'As a friend, Alfonso is absolutely qualified. As a captain... Fine, there isn't anyone to compare him to anyway.'
This piece of paper has been waterlogged for so long that the letters on it are no longer legible.
'Soil is the cradle of life. They say that when the spring wind blows, green shoots will sprout here.'
'I can feel the excitement in each and every one of us. We are about to face a cornerstone of the truth.'
'Those with power tend to underestimate their ability. Even more so for those with great power.'
'Once ambition germinates, it knows only how to proliferate. Even if it's clear it will only lead to ruin.'
'Do you hear the sound of the tides? It's as if someone is sobbing.'
'Friends, we are all starting to get old. Yesterday, Breogan spent half the day complaining about his new wrinkles. I think it's because he frowns too much.'
'...Leviathan...Ægir...lost...Abyssal Hunters... This plan is our last hope.'
Even if the rewards of this fantasy are false, the encouragement and joy you receive are real.
Even if the rewards of this fantasy are false, the encouragement and joy you receive are real.

A rumor began to circulate in the shelter from the encroaching waters: Breogan, the man who invited the Silence, died in an alley as punishment for angering the sea. This news did not particularly make any waves, as the people were more concerned with whether they'd go hungry tomorrow.

techDesList: A warped mailbox with a strange device crammed into it, the words 'Wilderness Survival Module' printed on the side in Ægirian, seemingly slotting into 'Little Handy.' Who put it here, and what message are they trying to send to whom?

Open the cabinet's swaying doors, and a complex-looking device can be found resting inside. A thin line of Ægirian text along its side reads: 'Housekeeping Assistant Module.' It seems to fit into one of the slots on 'Little Handy.' It appears to have been carefully stashed here at some point, but where did it come from?

In the maintenance access corridor, a special device can be found leaning against the wall, marked with the Ægirian letters, 'Incremental Motion Firmware.' It seems to fit into one of the slots on 'Little Handy.' Hard to imagine how this thing can be used to help people exercise.

The Stultifera Navis is not only a battleship, but also houses a large number of research facilities. The unrecognizable equipment in the hydrology workstation regularly makes noises, but there is no longer anyone who can interpret them.
A delicate device has been placed here, its underside labeled with a single line of Ægirian: 'Mini Decontamination Kit.' It seems to fit into one of the slots on 'Little Handy.'

'When did Breogan bring his Little Handy with him onto land? If I knew earlier, I would've brought mine too—it always helps me get the colors I need. He even bought an External Upgrade Module for it! That thing's expensive as hell!'

choiceDesList: A rustling sound comes from the empty shop. Is it the struggling of a victim, or...?

Judging from the equipment remaining amidst the embers, this newly burnt-down house was a secret research facility not too long ago. The Church of the Deep cultists were trying to uncover the secrets of evolution. They seemed to possess academic curiosity as well, not just blind faith.

The factory has been abandoned for many years, the skeletons of incomplete ships scattered among mechanical giants like corpses rotting in the wilderness, their flesh and blood plucked away. This factory came to life along with Gran Faro itself, its ambitious builders certainly unable to imagine that things would end this way.

The calamity completely reshaped Iberia's coastline, and the majestic harbor built more than seventy years ago sank into the sea without a trace. It goes without saying that Coldreef Port cannot hold a candle to it. Though small, it still reserves a few berths for massive ships. In reality, those ships would never return to port.

This small cottage still holds onto signs of life. When the calamity struck without warning, the guards stationed here were never heard from again. But now, more than sixty years later, there is still a guard staring out the window at the sea. His body has long since decayed, and his eye sockets hollow, but duty is nevertheless duty.

There are several pieces of damaged art in the officer's lounge: large, torn-apart oil paintings, pure-white sculptures shattered into pieces, caved-in bronze reliefs... There are also more bizarre things, like a billiards table inlaid with silver, and a number of poker cards with intricate patterns that appear to be hand-drawn.
A strange noise comes from the room, as if something is persistently rapping against the wall—regular and hollow, persistent and monotonous.

This used to be the toolroom on the Stultifera, used to store instruments, tools, and supplies needed for the ship's maintenance. But for a ship that has had to endure a horrific calamity, losing its mobility in the process, banking on these tools alone might be a bit of wishful thinking.

Above this room's door hangs a sign that reads 'First Galley.' From the size and scale of this kitchen alone, one can already imagine the grand occasions on which sumptuous dishes would emerge from here.

A training area packed with Sea Terrors, seemingly startled awake by the sound of hunting bells. This place, once used for human training, is now their hatchery. In the darkness, sets of eyes shine with an eldritch glow, the sounds of crawling and slithering fill the air, and their hostility is practically palpable.

A chapel included on the ship, its eikon overlooking every guest who visits. Many years ago, sailors once came here to confess their sins and unburden their souls. Now, the only thing that might enter this ornate chapel is the occasional lost Sea Terror.

The records room most likely housed all of the Iberian Grand Fleet's confidential files at one point. All sorts of documents related to personnel, deployment plans, and tactical arrangements were sealed away into safes, one-by-one. Now, they are nothing more than piles of refuse.
The area inside the pipe shaft is a complete mess. It seems that some brutal fighting occurred here, and based on the sword marks left behind, both sides must've been human.

A room enclosed by iron fencing. From the text on the sign, it used to be a solitary confinement cell. But now it will clearly never perform that function again: the cell has been breached from the inside, with the fence torn apart and its broken iron bars strewn across the ground.
Around the mooring winch are a large number of Sea Terrors curling up and degenerating, turning themselves into masses of nutrient-rich muscle fiber to offer up to their kin.
The injured Seaborn seeks to flee for its life. It feeds on its kin, amassing itself. It can feel that it has arrived before a broken-through door.
The injured Seaborn is looking for an escape route. It needs nutrients, it needs direction. It can feel that it is but a step away from the answer it has always sought.
The injured Seaborn stopped moving. It is thinking, it is realizing. It can feel that it has questions that cannot be answered, and needs to find a way to resolve that.
Dense swarms of Sea Terrors fill this place, slowly shifting, squeezing, multiplying. Something is hidden amidst them—the injured Seaborn may well be here, rejuvenating its strength.
A strange sound is coming from somewhere, a murmur that is not human, like the babbling of a baby. It is the Seaborn's voice. Find it and put an end to this overly long farce.
The Seaborn is once more on the starboard deck. It still preys on its own kin, amassing itself. It continues to linger in front of the broken gate.
The injured Seaborn is looking for an escape route. It needs nutrients, it needs direction. It can feel that it is but a step away from the answer it has always sought.
The injured Seaborn stopped moving. It is thinking, it is realizing. It can feel that it has questions that cannot be answered, and needs to find a way to resolve that.
A rough, heavy breathing comes from the shadows. Something is lurking inside, perhaps the injured Seaborn? Find it, and kill it. This is a battle for survival.
A strange sound is coming from somewhere, a murmur that is not human, like the babbling of a baby. It is the Seaborn's voice. Find it and put an end to this overly long farce.
On the starboard deck, the wounded Seaborn continues to linger, preying on its own kin, amassing itself. It is still searching for the gate's location.
The injured Seaborn stopped moving. It is thinking, it is realizing. It can feel that it has questions that cannot be answered, and needs to find a way to resolve that.

In his haze, he knew he had to make a decision. Perhaps he'd already made it in the past, but now, both the result and even the choice itself have been long forgotten. Then why not cast the dice again, and see where the road leads—or if the road ended long ago?

If there were something he'd done differently—perhaps more compromises, more concessions, more backing down—if he could've set aside his obsession and perseverance, might there have been another possibility? Alas, such is the nature of ambitions unfulfilled. Even within a false possibility, he seeks to grasp it once more.

If there were something he'd done differently—perhaps more consideration, more planning, more understanding—if he could've mustered his courage and resourcefulness, might there have been another possibility? Alas, such is the nature of a status quo unbroken. Even within a false possibility, he seeks to challenge it once more.

Thoughts rush through his head, a myriad of past experiences appearing in his mind's eye—difficult to touch and impossible to catch. He can feel cold, but not pain. Why not continue to sink into indulgence, continue to play out these choices and decisions? Perhaps there is a way out, perhaps it is right before his eyes.

Emotions surge, and their inevitable destination is disappointment. The difference between regret and disappointment is that regret contains deep pain and resentment, whereas disappointment bears only a touch of sorrow. Those who wished to meet once more and share a toast may never have that chance ever again.

Emotions surge, and their inevitable destination is indignation. The difference between regret and indignation is that regret assumes the original choice was in error, whereas indignation only accepts that the outcome was dissatisfactory. Those who wanted to roam the land, exploring the wanderer's path, may never have that chance ever again.

Was there any point to burning himself out to do all this? He tried to find answers. Locating one's own position in the annals of history is a challenge that every person must face. He feels a little drowsy—perhaps this question wasn't as important as he originally thought. After all, things have already played out as they did.

He notices something flowing down his dry eyes, salty and bitter, reminding him of the hometown he can no longer return to. The hatred still remains in his heart, and he decides to no longer try to let it go, but instead to embrace it. That turns out to be significantly easier.

He notices something flowing down his rigid body, crimson and damp, reminding him of his ruined hometown. The responsibility still weighs on his shoulders, and he decides to no longer try to fulfill it, but instead to let it rest here. That turns out to be slightly easier.

How many heroes use fate to justify themselves, and how many fools use it to excuse themselves? He tries to brace his body with his palms once more, but fails once more. People disperse in front of him—why does this scene seem so familiar? He remembers. They had come to him the same way before.

Where could that glorious flagship be now? A pity, for only the darkened skies remain in his vision. He consoles himself that it is almost over, and as for those wishes... a human's power cannot hold out forever. Wait a bit longer. Give them a little more time.

Does that great lighthouse still stand now? A pity, for only the darkened skies remain in his vision. He consoles himself that it is almost over, and as for those dreams... a human's power cannot hold out forever. Wait a bit longer. Give them a little more time.

Very well, the end has come. He suddenly realizes that he seems willing to accept this outcome. Of course, as his final resting place, this place is too cold and too hard, a far cry from the comfort of a pillow, from resting his eyes by a warm fire. Not to mention, his gut has been punctured several times, and his lifeblood oozes out.
But, it could be worse. He decides to forgive those who are quickly dispersing, slinking back into the shadows. If their positions were reversed, he might feel the same anger.

He gave it his all, and failed. He could not beat the ocean at its game after all. But maybe he didn't lose too badly. Those who put him to death are still willing to feel anger, and is that not hope?
'Good luck, my friends. To those above land, and to those beneath the sea.'

eventDesList: A man, who has clearly consumed excessive amounts of cheap alcohol over a long period of time, is muttering ambiguously, lamenting his lack of a worthwhile life. Upon hearing that foreigners are visiting town, he finally lifts his eyelids, revealing the cloudy pupils underneath.

'Alive Until Sunset? A rock-and-roll band? Pah!' The man snorts sharply. 'Let them rock-and-roll their way back to where they belong. We all know that this is just another of the Inquisition's cheap tricks, and they're not welcome here!'
The man picks up his bottle and walks out of the tavern unsteadily. His trailing voice is still faintly audible: 'They've already ruined this place, what used to be our...'
The only things left in the tavern are wine-stained blotches and knocked-over chairs.
A ragged beggar leans against the side of the chapel, his hands clasped together tightly. He is not so much praying as simply existing, hardly any different from a pebble.
Day or night, young or old, healthy or sick, nothing matters to him. Nobody cares about him, and he also cares about nobody.
The beggar bows his head deeply, tears rolling from his eyes: 'I don't deserve to be promoted.'
The beggar bows his head deeply, tears rolling from his eyes: 'I don't deserve to be promoted.'

The devout gather around the chapel, trembling as they close their eyes. They turn around and press their foreheads against the cold wall, as if the chapel's weather-worn stone had become their last pillar of support.
'Fire! Light! He's brought light!' An old man covers his eyes, convulsing as he screeches.
The people remain as motionless as statues, the twitching old man no longer anywhere to be seen. Nobody is willing to reveal where he went.
There's nobody left in the cellar.
The arrival of outsiders has disturbed this peaceful town. It would be better to ask around at the Bitterscale Tavern.
A strange wheeled device rolls down from the pile of debris, covered in dust and missing parts but still emitting a strange glow. It's unclear what activated it, but it nevertheless whirrs to life.
Around its chassis are the words 'Little Handy' written in Ægirian. If its missing components can be found, it may prove unexpectedly helpful on the battlefield.
The only thing left here is useless garbage.
Cultists have infiltrated the town, and the growling of monsters drifts from the shadows. It is impossible to pass through here.

An old man's vigilant eyes peer out from behind the curtains. He had experienced this decades ago, and is no stranger to it. Their hopes of rebuilding are being crushed underfoot, and the instigator is someone they believed in.

The friends regarded as brothers have disappeared into the shadows, the plans into which countless hours were poured have been put on hiatus, and the imposing man with a lantern says that the cult has infiltrated you.
The old man gazes at the photo hanging upside-down over his bed. The once-dazzling sunset has faded.
And thus, a dream was shattered.
Between monsters and humans, which is truly more terrifying?
The curtains have been drawn shut, concealing the peoples' vigilant eyes.
Cultists have infiltrated the town, and their rituals are blocking the way.
A Sea Terror is curled up behind the counter, with an elderly woman sitting across from it.

A stack of diagrams lies scattered between the old woman and the Sea Terror. Though half her face is concealed by a hood, she is undoubtedly staring at the creature before her. Many years ago, she had dedicated all her talents to Iberia's greatest expedition, but that intrepidity ended in a terrifying silence.

After experiencing hardship, struggle, and disillusionment, she gave herself to a greater cause, one transcending country or geography—she sought to find the perfect other side that all living things could cross over to.
What's more, within the cult, she is able to continue the research on monsoons and hydrology that has captivated her so.

Now that the Inquisition has arrived, the products of her blood, sweat, and tears must be burned, her theories never to see the light of day. She chose to dedicate them to a Cycle of the great evolution, to a Sea Terror.
Sea Terrors roam right in front of her, but do no more than roam. Fortunately, she is patient.
There is nothing behind the counter.
There is nothing useful behind the shed.
There is nothing inside the mailbox.
Until the forward base finds a way to deal with the nethersea brand, it is inadvisable to rush ahead through this area.
Only useless debris remains in this collapsed house.
The documents in the file cabinet escape a fiery fate.
The samples in the specimen storage escape a fiery fate.
The file cabinet holds materials that the Church of the Deep's cultists have been researching for a long time. From the dates and labels, their research began many years ago.
The promise of an evolutionary end-goal is so enticing and so real that it can drive the brightest minds to work towards it day and night, sacrificing themselves.
A few lines of handwriting are scribbled onto the file's header, perhaps a spark of inspiration from the cultist who recorded it.
'What does it mean to become a part of the cycle of evolution? It means to be truly free from all suffering.'

The specimen storage contains a staggering number of samples, including photographs, anatomical diagrams, and tissue cross-sections. Some of these species have never been observed in the evolutionary record.
The promise of an evolutionary end-goal is so enticing and so real that it can drive the brightest minds to work towards it day and night, sacrificing themselves.
How did the cultists feel towards the creatures they worshipped? When their scalpels sliced through the flesh of the Sea Terror, did they feel the same pain as if their own skin was being cut?
Or will humanity's curiosity eventually supersede faith?
The documents have been removed, and the file cabinet is empty.
The samples have been removed, and the specimen storage is now empty.
Pretty much anything of value has already been whisked away, but the collectors over the years seem to have overlooked the toolbox in the corner.

Hidden inside the toolbox in the corner are several blueprints and a notepad. The blueprints, signed by chief naval architect Breogan, depict a massive battleship, the magnum opus of Iberia's Golden Age before calamity struck.
But both Gran Faro and this factory were born after the calamity, and the ships slated to be built here were nothing more than laughable toys compared to even the smallest in the fleet.
The engineers here still carry with them blueprints of things that can no longer be brought into being. Are they meant for technical reference, or are they merely holding onto a beautiful dream?
Funnily enough, even this parody of the Golden Age is filled with nothing but corpses.
There is nothing left in the factory worth investigating.
A few of the small vessels prepared beforehand by the Penal Battalion are moored in the port. When they set sail into the sea for the first time, they will face completely unknown winds and waves.

After the plan to build Gran Faro was put on hold, Coldreef Port was almost never used. The few voyages in the port's records were mostly small-scale search missions carried out by the Inquisition and the Penal Battalion.
Nobody ever returned from those expeditions.
Today, this long-since lonely port will finally see off another ship from its embrace. Its crew will set out to find the Eye of Iberia that is still looking out over the ocean.

The Penal Battalion prepared the boat in advance, the old dockworker carrying out work he was unfamiliar with: loading the vessel with supplies for the voyagers. The boat slowly left the port, disappearing from the people's sight.
The dockworker thought to himself that he might never get the chance to send off another ship in his few remaining years.
The ships have already left the port. May they return as scheduled.
There is nobody here.
There may be clues to crossing the ocean in this abandoned factory.
A long voyage is extremely dangerous. You'll need to head to Coldreef Port first to make ample preparations.

This diary records the years that the lighthouse's keepers spent here. One day, the silent waves swept through everything, and they found themselves trapped here in the middle of the ocean. At first, there was fear and panic. Then, there was an attempt to escape. Finally, they accepted their fate.

Even when dignity, civilization, and all that humans are meant to rely on are cast aside, it is not all that difficult to survive. Whenever one falls in their duties, they become nutrients for another to continue the vigil.
The text on the last page of the diary is smudged with water, now barely legible.
'All that we do, even sin and blasphemy, is not for the sake of our ultimate victory. It is for the hope that our defeat can be slightly delayed.'

Upon opening the drawers, the keepers' belongings can be seen neatly stowed inside. By the looks of it, someone had fastidiously tidied the place. There is a broken dagger in the drawer, no doubt having been in a brutal fight. There is also half a pack of tobacco, but no matches to go along with it, which must have disappointed the original owner.

There are also a few Arts Units here that have fallen apart, with signs of having been repaired as much as possible. Additionally, there is a photo, effaced by the passage of time, that is now completely unidentifiable.
A small communication terminal is located here, the knob that adjusts its frequency band worn shiny-smooth.
There are still a few pieces of weathered jerky of unclear origin.
Everything in the warehouse has already been emptied out.
There is nothing worth taking from this safe.
There is nothing left in this cabinet.

For whatever reason, the traces of the passing years can be seen on this note. It has never been moved, replaced, or dusted—always remaining in its original position, faithfully conveying the message left by the one who penned it. Day after day, year after year.
'Don't touch them. Those are my treasures, and you'll pay if anything goes missing!'
'Try to control yourself the next time you get into a fight. There aren't many things left on this ship to prove where we came from.'
After the passage of a great many moons, the original witnesses have long disappeared, but these manuscripts remain elegant and dignified.

The locked door has been opened. This area inside the lounge originally was a small conference room, but by the looks of things, the last meeting held here did not go very well. Documents are strewn all over the ground, trampled upon by panicked footprints.

A huge chart hangs in the conference room, marking the positions of every ship in the Grand Fleet. The icons that once represented their existence have all been extinguished, leaving the chart empty. Its azure background now symbolizes the boundless ocean upon which this flagship floats, alone.
And thus, the mightiest fleet ever known to Terra quietly dissolved into this blue expanse.
Join the pride and ambition of Iberia past.
There is nothing worth taking from the ship's lavatory.
Unsurprisingly, it's a Sea Terror. It stumbles to a halt and turns around.

If Sea Terrors also possess the mental state of 'confusion,' then the Sea Terror before your eyes is without a doubt confused. It seems to have been battling a wall for some time now, a side of its body thorny and chitinous from the collisions. If it has no way to leave, it will ultimately give up, turning itself into nutrients for its kin.

Its body has been impaled with a string of keys, likely remnants of its last mortal struggle. Its opponent had likely broken their blade and reached for whatever sharp objects were available, persisting until the bitter end.
Perhaps the wound just happened to cut into a certain nerve node in the Sea Terror. Or perhaps there is some other reason it escaped to the crew quarters and decided to do battle against a wall.
There might even be another possibility...
In any case, pull out the keys, and put an end to its miserable existence.
There is nothing left here except a bed that will never again offer sweet dreams to anyone.

It may well be the case that even the most skilled craftsmen of today's nations would be helpless before these devices. Not because of how complex their structure is, but rather from the difficulty of operating their Arts Units.

Most of these tools are fairly simple for a beginner to operate: a flip of a switch and a few button presses, and they'll spring to life and efficiently get the job done. The only issue is, nobody knows exactly why they work.
Just as humans cannot imagine walking without legs or grasping without hands, these machines lack any kind of reasonable engine or power supply mechanism. Only god knows how they work.
The way they use Originium is completely different.

At the bottom of the drawer is a sheet of paper that has long since yellowed. Next to it are words written in striking red paint: 'Don't go to the deck. Don't jump overboard. Don't allow yourself to sink! Read it, remember it, remember who you are!'

This piece of paper seems to have been cut from the officers' manual, and is filled with flamboyant rhetoric boasting that this ship 'can be called a palace on the Iberian Sea, a mobile throne for exalted kings.'
The officers and researchers lucky enough to be selected as the crew of the Stultifera Navis were the most outstanding talents of Iberia's Golden Age.

One of the passages was marked with a highlighter: 'In any given era, there are only so many names that will be remembered. History, in all its cruelty, shows no mercy to the mediocre. Congratulations, most glorious crewmember—you will surely enter the annals of history.'
There is nothing worth taking from the storage room.
There are still unopened rooms in the officer's lounge. Make sure there are no potential threats before continuing on.

As its name suggests, the First Galley is one of several kitchens. In addition, there's a kitchen for preparation and plating, another for desserts, and so on. The crew here is served delectable dishes worthy of their honorable statuses, or at least they were in the past.

Naturally, the calamity, and the starvation that ensued, quickly and mercilessly stripped people of their veneer of virtue. However, let us pray that the blackened bloodstains in the corner of the galley are but accidental splatters from the chef carving cystybeast steak.
The desalination unit installed in the kitchen seems to have been out of use for many years. Even the hardiest of races cannot survive by drinking sea water.
Their ultimate fate was to die of dehydration in the middle of the ocean.
Mist scatters in every direction when the freezer door is opened. It's been on this entire time.
Dozens of Sea Terror carcasses are lined up neatly in the freezer. There are many different kinds, and some are no longer complete, their wounds smooth and most likely caused by a clean cut.

A few other skeletons of various shapes and sizes have been hung in a way that could be described as disconcerting, but it is simply a collection of different evolutionary trajectories. From the differing rates of discoloration in the bones, their ages vary as well, possibly spanning decades.
By the looks of it, this ship has also welcomed some non-speaking guests.
This ballroom has entertained all sorts of guests. Why not head to the First Galley and see if there are any delicacies there yet to be served?
A strange noise comes from the distance. It seems that this ball has not yet ended.
Draw your blade—this is a battle for survival.

In the end, a Sea Terror is nothing more than a Sea Terror, and the battle soon reaches its conclusion. They slink back into the darkness to recuperate, awaiting their next opportunity. That is the nature of the hunt—you are either the hunter, or the prey.
A rather large Sea Terror died under the watch of its kin. From its peduncle hangs a pocket watch which, based upon its engravings, once belonged to the navigator of the Stultifera Navis.
From the perspective of their species' survival, would Sea Terrors ever evolve a compulsion to collect?
The training area has been cleared out.
An eikon overlooks every guest who comes here.

Before the calamity, the Church of Iberia had already drifted from Lateran orthodoxy. It no longer wished its flock to be shackled by Lateran law, and His Holiness in Laterano seemed unaware of the schism. In the end, the Iberians discovered that only they can bring themselves salvation.

The ship's chapel is a typical product of the post-schism era, its eikon no longer holding a gun but instead taking up sword and lantern. The Church of Iberia has already written its own Scriptures, and with the king's support, plans to have a pope of its own.
Now that all of this has been reduced to ash, only the Inquisition remains to lead Iberia forward.

In the corner of the church lies a row of standard-issue sailor hats, their original owners long gone, hidden beneath the waves. However, this little token of commemoration is enough to prove that there are still those who do not wish to forget them.

Under one of the hats is a half-roll of cipher book pages. The remaining pages are filled with various ciphers, one of which matches with the password format seen in the Records Room. Unfortunately, it remains incomplete.
There is no longer anything noteworthy here.

Other than a table, a few chairs, a lamp in the middle of the room, and the safes of various sizes lining up all the way to the ceiling, there are practically no other items here. The person in charge of this place must've been quite organized.
Most of the safes here haven't been locked, the documents inside them now meaningless. Only one of the larger ones remains firmly shut, requiring a passcode to open.
The heavy safe door slides open, revealing nothing inside except a copy of the ship's personnel files. By reading it, you catch a glimpse of everything the Stultifera has suffered since the calamity.

When the Silence struck, the massive fleet collided with the terrible waves almost head-on, suffering heavy casualties. When the waves subsided, the Stultifera spent a while trying to find any other ships or survivors out at sea, but with little luck, as its own propulsion system had been damaged.

Then, the monsters appeared. Within half a month of the calamity, the crew had been reduced by more than half, every inch of the deck stained red with blood. A year later, the ship's supplies ran low, and the remaining hundred crew members began their long struggle.
The following records are filled with horrific, appalling words: betrayal, madness, chewing, transformation...
Twenty years after the calamity, only sixteen people remained alive and sane on the ship.
This place is dark and messy. In a lightless corner lies a skeleton.

No, upon closer inspection, you realize that it's actually two skeletons entangled together. One of the skeletons seems so... warped and twisted that it resembles the bones left behind by a certain species of Sea Terror.
One longsword pierced through what had once been their chests, while a second sword remains in their grasp. By the looks of it, they had been the ones to drive the first sword through their bodies.
Why would their deaths be like this? What was their relationship? What were they thinking before they died? Perhaps nobody will ever know.

Around the skeletons, a half-roll of cipher book pages is sitting in the corner. The remaining pages are filled with various ciphers, one of which matches the password format seen in the Records Room. Unfortunately, it remains incomplete.
There is nothing worth investigating here.
There are a few horrible gashes left on the walls of this corridor. Perhaps the Records Room will tell of what exactly happened here.
A strange rubbing noise comes from beside your ear. Quickly retreat to the Golden Corridor and prepare to confront the unknown foe.
There is nothing worth taking from the chain locker.
A strange rubbing noise comes from beside your ear. Quickly retreat to the Golden Corridor and prepare to confront the unknown foe.
There is nothing worth picking up here.
There is nothing of interest in the hall at this moment, but you're much more interested in the place labeled as the 'Confinement Room.'
A strange rubbing noise comes from beside your ear. Quickly retreat to the Golden Corridor and prepare to confront the unknown foe.
Unexpectedly, there's a desk in the Confinement Room, with an unfinished letter sitting on top of it.
The letter is dripping with a suspicious mucus that closely resembles the nethersea brand, but seems to have already dried up with the passage of time.

The top half of the letter is still relatively clean, appearing to be addressed to the writer's family. He repeatedly expressed his longing for them, and his guilt for no longer being able to be with them.
As the dripping mucus increased, the handwriting became more and more messy. The writer indicated that he would soon go home to see the children, and would bring them lots of presents.
The rest of the letter was almost completely covered in mucus, and only a few words such as 'ocean' and 'return' can be made out.
The last line written on the letter is extremely neat: 'We are one.'
There is nothing noteworthy here.
You'll need to head to the Main Bridge to unlock the Drafting Room's security system.
There is nothing worth picking up here.
You'll need to pass through the Command Hall to reach this place.
You'll need to head to the Main Bridge first to confront the captain.

For more than sixty years, for twenty-thousand days and nights, this ship has endured far too many storms, as well as matters of life and death. It will not sink, just as Iberia will not sink, and this is not a fact that requires explanation—so it must be, therefore it is.

The white-haired captain gazes out the porthole, to the part of the ocean that can no longer even be considered scenery. For the first few decades, he spent a lot of time on the observation deck, hoping to get a glimpse of the land he once called home, even if no more than a small island.

There was nothing. Nothing but water, a boundless expanse of water. It bored him, annoyed him, enraged him, and finally forced him to look away. Nothing would happen there, and it no longer had anything to do with his fate.

For reasons unknown, the captain suddenly felt as if he had not seen enough of this nameless ocean. He decided that when this farce was all over, he and his chief mate would quietly watch the sunrise, just as they had done many, many years ago.
There is nobody along the bridge access.
They must be eliminated. This kind of evolution is an abomination.

How would sociologists analyze the social constructs of the Sea Terrors and the Seaborn? No, the scholars would only be able to throw their hands up in defeat. Because human society is built on selfishness, morality, cowardice, and bravery. Our ugliness has built the foundation for these flashes of greatness.

However, these creatures' understanding of kinship is beyond our comprehension. Humans extol martyrdom because it symbolizes morality, and because it is so rare. But Sea Terrors may well never see it from such an angle, labeling their choices neither virtue nor vice.
They have only one goal. All of their actions are in service of that singular goal. They have no castes, no individual interests. They seek only to reach the endpoint of evolution.
That is precisely why humans must fight them to the bitter end.
The area around the mooring winch has already been cleared out.
There's a strange rustling sound coming from the mooring winch. It'd be best to check it out.
It is critical to locate the injured Seaborn as quickly as possible.
The starboard deck is completely empty. Locate the Seaborn.
The bow deck is completely empty. Locate the Seaborn.
The port deck is completely empty. Locate the Seaborn.
The signal light array has been occupied by a large number of Sea Terrors, and must be cleared out.
The signal light array has been occupied by a large number of Sea Terrors, and must be cleared out.
The ceremonial plaza is completely empty. The time to fight has not yet come.
The only sound that can be heard here is the beeping of the indecipherable research equipment.
It must be stopped.
Its kind senses the imminence of evolution. They swarm forth, their flesh clogging the way, using death to hold back their enemies. The Seaborn is fleeing into their midst. It still needs more time.
The Seaborn has already fled from here. All that's left is a mess on the floor.
It must be stopped.
Its kind senses a hope for the future. They swarm forth, their blood congealing into a bastion, using death to erect a mighty wall. The Seaborn is fleeing into their midst. It still needs more time.
The Seaborn has already fled from here. All that's left is a mess on the floor.
It must be stopped.

The creature looks out at the sea, towards where it was born, towards where it will end up. It cannot comprehend what has transpired within this floating box. It cannot comprehend the strangers and kin that have tried to hurt it.
It lingers, brooding. It feels as if the answer is within its grasp, yet has no way to describe it.
Soon. Very soon.
The Seaborn has already left.
It must be stopped.

The lumbering mass crawling around amidst the swarm is just another Sea Terror that has grown massive. Was this an unconscious coincidence, or an astute ruse? There's no time to think too deeply about this—the injured Seaborn must be located.
There is nothing here other than a mess on the floor.
Without a doubt, the sound is coming from somewhere nearby.

Without a doubt, the streaks of blood leading to the starboard deck came from the injured Seaborn. Head to the Starboard Deck and continue to track down the Seaborn—it must be taken care of before it grows too strong.
There is nothing noteworthy here.
It must be stopped.
Its kind senses the imminence of evolution. They swarm forth, their flesh clogging the way, using death to hold back their enemies. The Seaborn is fleeing into their midst. It still needs more time.
The Seaborn has already fled from here. All that's left is a mess on the floor.
It must be stopped.
Its kind senses a hope for the future. They swarm forth, their blood congealing into a bastion, using death to erect a mighty wall. The Seaborn is fleeing into their midst. It still needs more time.
The Seaborn has already fled from here. All that's left is a mess on the floor.
It must be stopped.

The creature looks out at the sea, towards where it was born, towards where it will end up. It cannot comprehend what has transpired within this floating box. It cannot comprehend the strangers and kin that have tried to hurt it.
It lingers, brooding. It feels as if the answer is within its grasp, yet has no way to describe it.
Soon. Very soon.
The Seaborn has already left.
It must be stopped.

The lumbering mass lurking in the shadows is just another Sea Terror that has grown massive. Was this an unconscious coincidence, or an astute ruse? There's no time to think too deeply about this—the injured Seaborn must be located.
There is nothing here other than a mess on the floor.
Without a doubt, the sound is coming from somewhere nearby.

Without a doubt, the streaks of blood leading to the starboard deck came from the injured Seaborn. Head to the Starboard Deck and continue to track down the Seaborn—it must be taken care of before it grows too strong.
There is nothing noteworthy here.
It must be stopped.
Its kind senses the imminence of evolution. They swarm forth, their flesh clogging the way, using death to hold back their enemies. The Seaborn is fleeing into their midst. It still needs more time.
The Seaborn has already fled from here. All that's left is a mess on the floor.
It must be stopped.

The creature looks out at the sea, towards where it was born, towards where it will end up. It cannot comprehend what has transpired within this floating box. It cannot comprehend the strangers and kin that have tried to hurt it.
It lingers, brooding. It feels as if the answer is within its grasp, yet has no way to describe it.
Soon. Very soon.
The Seaborn has already left.
There is nothing here.
The only sound that can be heard here is the beeping of the indecipherable research equipment.
Supplies are rationed out, and cannot be claimed multiple times.
The story can only be continued after the three subsections, 'Ship of Fools,' 'Far-Seeing Lighthouse,' and 'Engulfing Waves' have been pieced together.

Upon opening the atlas covered with thick dust, you see a brief preface. The author claims to be but a poor soul far from home, whose name is insignificant. To record the life that he and his friends had experienced, and to keep their memories from drowning beneath the waves, he picked up the brush.

Surprisingly, the atlas seems to be quite popular with children, their doodles often visible in its pages' margins. Perhaps the ones who grew up on land are using everything in their hands to tirelessly search for their nebulous homeland called 'Ægir.'
For some reason, the pages in the atlas are shuffled and scattered. This story will have to be slowly reassembled.

'Breogan has convinced us that Ægir has sunk into the quagmire of arrogance. Our cities are falling, our homes submerged in the abyss, but the consuls still believe in our imminent victory. No, we need to seek another path.'

'We mustn't forget that though the ocean is vast, it is far from being the entire world. The land-dwellers are weak and short-sighted, but the power of change may well dwell within them. They have been besieged by the calamity of Originium, yet have learned to harness its power.'

'Breogan never promised that this place would have the answers Ægir sought, but it is at least a new path. I still remember the moment we first set foot on land. The sand beneath my feet was no different from Ægir, but that was the first time I really felt what it was like to be caressed by the wind.'

'The place we landed is called Iberia, a country that is as wildly arrogant as it is backwards. It seems that pride is the common illness of all humanity, be it on land or at sea. We arrived along with Ægirian refugees fleeing disaster. The people on land have dubbed us Islanders.'

'However, everything on land was still a novelty to us, especially to Breogan, who never seemed anywhere near as excited when he was being called a genius back at the Academy. There is never an idle day for him, as he leaves no stone unturned, no question unasked, and even quickly integrates with the locals.'

'I really can't stand his complacent streak, what he's called 'the science of dealing with people.' Two days ago, he heard something from an old man that caught his interest, and immediately decided to set off on a journey I have little hope for. We know too little about this land to make blind ventures.'
'Alright, I guess I'll join his team after all. Hopefully, we don't end up dead along the way.'

'How long has it been since we left that place? Five years? Six? We have crossed the cities of Victoria, gazed out across the plains of Kazimierz, toured the Basilica of Laterano, and nearly perished in the snowfields of Ursus. Now, we face Sargon's endless golden sands.'
'Breogan is right, we are indeed approaching that truth. During our travels, we've briefly come into contact with several special beings, sometimes seen as prophets, messengers, or oracles.

'Yesterday, Breogan officially met with one of Them. They had an extremely difficult-to-say name that They insisted we use. I hope I didn't mispronounce it. Breogan chatted with Them for a good long while.'

''Feranmuts.' Terrestrial creatures of mythic proportions and unparalleled power. Breogan is trying to come up with a hypothesis, but to be honest, I'm taking the wait-and-see approach. They do have some similarities with the terrible creatures we've faced in the ocean, but they are also very different in other ways.'
'I hope that hypothesis of his exists only to be falsified.'

'We've returned to Iberia once more. Over a decade has passed, and the country doesn't seem to have changed much, but the number of Islanders has only increased. It seems the situation in Ægir is looking bleak. I am starting to feel homesick, not knowing if my city still stands.'
'Breogan's met a few friends in Iberia, a cleric named Carmen and a naval officer named Alfonso. They get together almost every day to discuss some, hah, 'grand plans.'

'He really is far too good at dealing with people, or perhaps I'm too much of a hermit who prefers the company of a paintbrush. Breogan told me that his predictions are getting better by the day, and that he's found a way to integrate Ægir technology with Originium, and simply needs an opportunity to put it into practice.'
'For example, being appointed as chief naval architect of Iberia.'

'Breogan is going to build a massive fleet for Iberia. Even a fool can see how ambitious their king is, but so be it. Perhaps Breogan spoke true—that we are but visitors on land, and our ultimate purpose is to aid Ægir.'

'I went to see the flagship while it was under construction. From an Ægir's perspective, it was a pretty average job, but for a country on land, it is a ship unlike anything they've ever seen. Breogan and Alfonso named it the Stultifera Navis, the Ship of Fools.'

'My guess is that even though the two of them have withstood the pressure and insisted on keeping the name, they might have wildly different interpretations of what it means. Breogan has been constantly frowning as of late, seemingly aware of something about to happen. Or he could simply be worn out, as the king has also tasked him with building lighthouses and ports.'

'Recently, he's become a darling of the Iberian media. Every paper heaps praise on him without a second thought, but I know his eyes are fixed on something greater. His judgment has always been correct, and I hope that remains the case.'
'All sounds have vanished. The tide is approaching.'
'A terrible wave. It will swallow us all.'
'Something must've happened to Ægir. I have to find Breogan.'
'I've already looked everywhere. Where is Breogan hiding? He couldn't have died in the Profound Silence, but the situation for him now is likely more dangerous than it was then.'

'That's right, he foresaw it long ago, but the countermeasures he prepared were taken as evidence that he was responsible for the calamity. He was branded an evil sorcerer who sacrificed Iberia to the waves. Even our identity as Ægir has become a mark of original sin, and the land-dwellers accuse us of bringing disaster in our wake.'
'I just saw an Ægir youth being beaten in a corner. The assailant was his Iberian neighbor, who he had always gotten along well with.'
'Damn it, I have to find Breogan again. No matter what happened to Ægir, we have to go back.'
You flip past the prologue, and the story slowly begins to unfold.
